title: [BUG] CVE-2023-6345 was reported to SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.2.88.7.nupkg
body:
### Description

Use the scan tool to check the vulnerabilities of the SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.2.88.7.nupkg, [CVE-2023-6345](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-6345) was reported. From the report, skia 88 is detected.

There are several articles about this vulnerability.
- https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2023/11/29/cve-2023-6345/
- https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/critical-zero-day-vulnerability-chrome-cve-2023-6345-ilangovan-xxgac

Please note, same vulnerability is reported to SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Win32.2.88.7.nupkg.

### Code

No code can be provided.

### Expected Behavior

Can someone please confirm whether skiasharp is vulnerable to the CVE-2023-6345?

### Actual Behavior

_No response_

### Version of SkiaSharp

Other (Please indicate in the description)

### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp

Other (Please indicate in the description)

### IDE / Editor

Other (Please indicate in the description)

comments.author: kekekeks
comments.body:
Seems to be this one - https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1432603

A bug in their SKSL compiler.

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: We don't expose that so it should not affect Avalonia

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: I do not believe it affects SkiaSharp as that API is not even compiled into libSkiaSharp. We do not enable the SKVM feature.

comments.author: cmoaciopm
comments.body: Thank you all for your information. Good to know SkiaSharp is not impacted.
